help-file.title: "SPELL CIRCLE"
help-file.content:
Just as in AD&D, Duris has placed its spells in various levels called circles. As a caster gains in level, he learns more of the magical arts and has a larger repertoire of spells to choose fro . These new spells exist in "Circles". At any given level, a caster can draw from a specified number of circles and can memorize/pray/tupor/assimilate/commune for a certain number of spells in each circle which fit into "Spell Slots". As a caster's level increases he learns more magic and can draw from more circles as well as regenerate more spells from each circle. The circles are gained as follows:
Level 1 -1st Circle Level 6 -2nd Circle Level 11 -3rd Circle Level 16 -4th Circle Level 21 -5th Circle Level 26 -6th Circle Level 31 -7th Circle Level 36 -8th Circle Level 41 -9th Circle Level 46 -10th Circle Level 51 -11th Circle Level 56 -12th Circle
See the specific help files on each class to find out which spells belong to each circle for any given class. There is a slight chance of spell failure for the last circle learned.
